newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson says wins $80 mln order, sees more.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson says wins $80 mln order, sees more.

text.p: Swedish telecommunications group AB LM Ericsson said on Monday its part in a consortium order from ICO Global Communications was worth $80 million.

It said the firm price of the initial consortium contract was around $600 million, but Ericsson said it expected this figure to increase to more than $1 billion over the next 10 years and that its own share would then be $150 million.

"ICO Global Communications, the global mobile satellite communications company, today awarded the definitive contract to a consortium of Ericsson, Hughes Network Systems Inc and NEC Corporation," Ericsson said in a statement.
It said the consortium, led by NEC Corporation, would supply the ground segment of ICO's global network.

"The contract is expected to increase in size to accommodate expected capacity growth and functionality enhancements over the next 10 years, to a total value in excess of $1 billion of which Ericsson's share will be $150 million," it said.
Installation will begin in September 1997 and will be completed in phases by August 2000, it said.
